alert.note: Alert for Big Island Summit (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 24 at 2:45PM HST until January 25 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY EXTENDED UNTIL MIDNIGHT HST TONIGHT FOR OAHU MOLOKAI LANAI AND FOR LOWER TONIGHT ELEVATIONS ON MAUI... ...HIGH WIND WARNING FOR MAUNA KEA AND MAUNA LOA SUMMITS UNTIL 6 PM HST THURSDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY CANCELLED FOR KAUAI AND NIIHAU... .Strong and gusty southwest winds are expected through this evening in the lower elevations of Oahu and Maui County as a cold front passes. Winds will be strongest in and near heavy showers, and where terrain most accelerates the flow over the north and east side of the islands, and over the central portions of Oahu and Maui. Over the Big Island Summits, west winds will continue to increase through the evening, becoming dangerously strong tonight. ...HIGH WIND WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THURSDAY... * WHAT...West winds strengthening to 40 to 60 mph tonight, with gusts near 80 mph expected. * WHERE...Big Island Summits. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can make driving and walking dangerous. The winds can forcefully open doors and damage hinges or slam doors shut, possibly causing injuries.
info.instruction: Be prepared for road-closures. Postpone travel to the summits until conditions improve.
